options.description: show this help message and exit
show program's version number and exit
Silences one level of message, least-important first.
Shorthand for 'as many -q as you need to shut it up'
Force the preprocessor to run to completion; fatal errors don't stop processing.
Prevents the processor from actually saving anything to disk, but otherwise fully runs.
Force all Bikeshed messages to be ASCII-only.
Print mode. Options are 'plain' (just text), 'console' (colored with console color codes), 'markup', and 'json'. Defaults to 'console'.
Determines what sorts of errors cause Bikeshed to die (quit immediately with an error status code). Default is 'fatal'; the -f flag is a shorthand for 'nothing'
Allows Bikeshed to see/include files from folders higher than the one your source document is in.
Allow some features to execute arbitrary code from outside the Bikeshed codebase.

subcommands.name: spec
subcommands.description: Process a spec source file into a valid output file.

options.description: show this help message and exit
Switches on some debugging tools. Don't use for production!
GitHub access token. Useful to avoid API rate limits. Generate tokens: https://github.com/settings/tokens.
Bring-Your-Own-Spec: turns off all the Bikeshed auto-niceties, so you can piecemeal its features into your existing doc instead. Experimental, let me know if things get crashy or weird.
Hacky support for outputting line numbers on all error messages. Disables output, as this is hacky and might mess up your source.

subcommands.name: echidna
subcommands.description: Process a spec source file into a valid output file and publish it according to certain automatic protocols.

options.description: show this help message and exit
GitHub access token. Useful to avoid API rate limits. Generate tokens: https://github.com/settings/tokens.
W3C username.
W3C password.
URL recording the decision to publish.
Flags update as editorial.
Comma-separated list of email addresses to ping with the publication status when complete.
Directories to bundle in the tar file. Defaults to examples/, diagrams/, and images/.
The spec is self-contained, do not bundle any extra directories in the tar file.

subcommands.name: watch
subcommands.description: Process a spec source file into a valid output file, automatically rebuilding when it changes.

options.description: show this help message and exit
GitHub access token. Useful to avoid API rate limits. Generate tokens: https://github.com/settings/tokens.

Bring-Your-Own-Spec: turns off all the Bikeshed auto-niceties, so you can piecemeal its features into your existing doc instead. Experimental, let me know if things get crashy or weird.

subcommands.name: serve
subcommands.description: Identical to 'watch', but also serves the folder on localhost.

options.description: show this help message and exit
Specify the port to serve it over.
Only allow connections from localhost.
GitHub access token. Useful to avoid API rate limits. Generate tokens: https://github.com/settings/tokens.
Bring-Your-Own-Spec: turns off all the Bikeshed auto-niceties, so you can piecemeal its features into your existing doc instead. Experimental, let me know if things get crashy or weird.
show this help message and exit
Forces Bikeshed to do a full update manually, rather than using the manifest to get the preprocessed update (which can be several minutes old).
Download crossref anchor data.
Download link backref data.
Download biblio data.
Download boilerplate files.
Download Can I Use... data.

Download test suite data.

subcommands.name: issues-list
subcommands.description: Process a plain-text issues file into HTML. Call with no args to see an example input text.

options.description: show this help message and exit
Output example Issues List template.
show this help message and exit
Prints those terms that will be exported for cross-ref purposes.
Prints the ref data for a given link text.
Runs the specified code and prints it.
Runs the specified code and prints it as formatted JSON.
Clobbers the readonly data files with the mutable ones.
Prints all the metadata parsed for the spec as JSON. Top-level keys are presented in increasing order of importance; second-level keys are in order of first appearance in each context.
show this help message and exit
--type LINKTYPE
--spec SPEC
--exact Only search for the exact text provided; don't apply Bikeshed's automatic conjugation help for plurals/etc.
Apply Bikeshed's logic for only returning the latest version of a given ref when it exists in multiple levels of a spec.
show this help message and exit
Finds HTML comments containing 'Big Text: foo' and turns them into comments containing 'foo' in big text.
show this help message and exit
Rebase the specified files.
Skip testing the real-world files in the repo, and only run the manually-written ones.

subcommands.name: profile
subcommands.description: Profiling Bikeshed. Needs graphviz, gprof2dot, and xdot installed.

options.description: show this help message and exit
Prune the graph to start with the specified root node.
Prune the graph to only show ancestors of the specified leaf node.
Save the graph to a specified SVG file, rather than outputting with xdot immediately.
